page.title: 03Acklington's Agriculture
page.content:
The land in our D-Block is very much agricultural. Acklington Village itself is surrounded by 7 farms, they are: Chester House, Cavil Head, Acklington Park, High Park, Cheeveley, Field House and Coal Houses.
The largest and most productive farms, at present, are: {High Park}farmed by Mr Moore. A mixed farm with large potato, silage and cattle sheds. 5 workers are employed. {Cavil Head}farmed by Mr John Howie. A mixed farm with approx 150 cattle and 140 sheep. Crops grown include wheat, barley, cabbages and turnips. {Acklington Park}farmed by Mr Jim Howie A mixed farm with a sizable dairy herd of Fresian & Ayrshire cows, plus 50 Border Leicester and 65 Suffolk ewes. {Field House}farmed by Mr Pickering. An arable farm of some 142 acres.
